data.title: Broad Town Vacation Rentals & Homes - England, United Kingdom
data.meta_description: Aug 12, 2024 - Rent from people in Broad Town, United Kingdom from € 18/night. Find unique places to stay with local hosts in 191 countries. Belong anywhere with Airbnb.
data.text:
Guest suite in Wiltshire

4.99 out of 5 average rating, 167 reviews4.99 (167)

Conkers Self-Contained Annexe

Conkers is a stylish and spacious self contained annexe within Chestnut House which has it's own private entrance and has recently been renovated to include a well equipped kitchen and luxurious bathroom. Sleeping for two adults is provided in a king-sized bed separated from an open plan living area by a bookshelf screen. A separate bedroom with two single beds can accomodate two children/teenagers. Conkers is in the Avebury World Heritage site and within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.

Guesthouse in Lower Stanton Saint Quintin

5 out of 5 average rating, 155 reviews5 (155)

Oak Framed Apartment in quiet Rural Location

Woodpecker Lodge has been beautifully furnished in a modern country style to reflect its rural surroundings. The Lodge has its own ensuite shower room and toilet, kitchenette, dining area, double bed, Sofa, TV, on site parking. Easy access to M4, just 2.5 miles from Junction 17. Situated in the South Cotswolds close to the historic market town of Malmesbury and picturesque villages including Lacock, Castle Combe and Badminton. Close to popular wedding venues, Kin House and Grittleton House.

Cottage in Wiltshire

4.97 out of 5 average rating, 271 reviews4.97 (271)

Mulberry Cottage Malmesbury

Mulberry Cottage is our lovely home from home, located in the heart of Malmesbury only a few minutes walk from shops, restaurants and bars. With its own private parking space, modern fitted kitchen and cosy log burner it's the perfect place to relax and unwind. With free WiFi, Smart TV, Bose Bluetooth speaker, Roberts DAB radio, two bedrooms with king sized beds, quality bed linen and two bathrooms. Towels are provided too, all you need to bring is yourself! (logs provided Dec and Jan only)

Guest suite in Wroughton

4.98 out of 5 average rating, 100 reviews4.98 (100)

Luxury 1 bed place Village location Free parking

Brambles Lodge with enclosed garden accessed occasionally by hosts Wroughton is well served by 6 pubs some offering dining. Next door is the popular Fox & Hounds often hosting live music In walking distance are local shops, takeaways, tea room & Clouts Wood nature reserve. Avebury & Barbury Castle both on the Ridgeway are a short drive. Bath 30 min drive, Swindon train station 10 min or served by bus with links to London, Bristol, Bath & Oxford Lockable bike shed. Welcome pack on arrival

Tiny home in Gloucestershire

4.95 out of 5 average rating, 209 reviews4.95 (209)

Glass-Fronted Tiny Home on Private Lake: Cotswolds

Island Lodge is a stunning glass-fronted luxury home, architecturally designed, and tucked away on the edge of the lake. Whether you are looking to propose, or simply want to find your next couples getaway, look no further. The stunning decor is accentuated by equally incredible views of the lake. Guests can enjoy the private decking area and the on-site hot tub. Whilst enjoying cosy nights beside the wood burner after an enjoyable evening at the pub. Welcome to Little Horseshoe Lake.

Cottage in Compton Bassett

4.92 out of 5 average rating, 142 reviews4.92 (142)

2 Freeth Cottages

Rural cottage on our family farm. Beautifully decorated and full of character. Large garden & plenty of parking. Well equipped Kitchen diner and log burner with good supply of logs in sitting room. Large flat screen in sitting room and television in both bedrooms. Upstairs bathroom & loo and additional shower room & loo downstairs Lots of lovely walks in the area and village pub also in walking distance. Close to Devizes & Marlborough with good independent shops and restaurants

Guesthouse in Wiltshire

4.98 out of 5 average rating, 256 reviews4.98 (256)

Self contained studio near Marlborough and Avebury

The property is totally private and provides stylish self contained studio accommodation away from the main house. It comprises a well equipped kitchen area, a luxurious en-suite shower room and a south facing private patio garden which offers lovely views of the surrounding countryside. Situated just two miles from the beautiful market town of Marlborough and near the ancient sites of Avebury and Silbury Hill, it offers the ideal country retreat to relax and unwind.

Cottage in Royal Wootton Bassett

4.93 out of 5 average rating, 129 reviews4.93 (129)

Horseshoe Cottage - Dog friendly in rural location

Horseshoe Cottage is in a peaceful location, enjoying rural views. Great for those wanting to holiday & explore the Wiltshire countryside or as a business commute to local towns. Near to Royal Wootton Bassett, a market town with a good selection of pubs, shops & restaurants & easy access to the M4 makes it is an ideal base for exploring Wiltshire & beyond. Nearby lakes & trails provide ideal opportunities for walking & cycling. Stonehenge & Avebury are also close by.

Cottage in Cirencester

4.94 out of 5 average rating, 136 reviews4.94 (136)

The Old Bakery At The Grange

Perfectly located for RIAT, being walking distance from the Green Entry Point, The Old Bakery At The Grange is an ideal cottage for exploring all that the Cotswolds has to offer whatever the season. We are a few minutes’ walk away from The Old Spotted Cow pub. The cottage is full of country character and the interiors reflect our love of travel. Due to the character features of the cottage, it is unsuitable for very young toddlers and those unsteady on their feet.

Cottage in CHIPPENHAM

4.91 out of 5 average rating, 188 reviews4.91 (188)

Kellaways House Cottage

Kellaways House Cottage is located in the small village of East Tytherton, Wiltshire close to the nearby market towns of Chippenham and Calne in the north of the county. Its rural setting provides a tranquil atmosphere without being too far from local amenities. The area is popular with walkers and cyclists, but if you want a bit more excitement, it is also perfectly situated to explore places further a feld in Wiltshire, East Somerset and the South Cotswolds.

Barn in Gloucestershire

4.98 out of 5 average rating, 284 reviews4.98 (284)

Luxury medieval barn in Cotswold town centre

Unique barn conversion nestled in a medieval alley in the heart of Fairford - open plan barn living with a snug living room and luxury bathroom. Climb the spiral staircase to the boutique bedroom or relax in the pretty, enclosed stone walled garden. We're next door to a lovely 15th century inn with a choice of other pubs nearby; Italian restaurant; local shops; pharmacy; cafes and takeaways on hand - a perfect base to explore this lovely part of the world!

Barn in Calne

4.95 out of 5 average rating, 347 reviews4.95 (347)

The Tiny Barn, self-contained rural studio

A perfect base in rural Wiltshire for visiting Stonehenge, Lacock, Castle Combe, Avebury, Salisbury Cathedral and Bath as well as the many other delights Wiltshire has to offer. Whether walking, cycling or sightseeing The Tiny Barn is ideally located in the rural hamlet of Studley. The Tiny Barn is part of a former smallholding with 17th Century origins which also comprises the farmhouse and 'The Stone Barn', also used as a holiday rental.
